item.title: ~Barrows Code Help~
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

case 9398:
if(playerHasItemAmount(6529, 6)==false)
{
sendMessage(“You do not have enough tokkul”);
sendMessage(“You need 6 tokkul”);
}
else if (playerHasItemAmount(6529, 6)==true) // Tokkul
deleteItem(6529, GetItemSlot(6529), 6);
addItem(Item2.randomBarrows(), 1);
break;

Why do you have boolean statements?

case 9398:
if(playerHasItemAmount(6529, 6)) {
deleteItem(6529, GetItemSlot(6529), 6);
addItem(Item2.randomBarrows(), 1);
} else
sendMessage(“You do not have enough tokkul”);
sendMessage(“You need 6 tokkul”);
break;

Try that, not really sure if it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: ~Barrows Code Help~
item.dc:creator: @Kindler Kindler
item.description:
@Kindler wrote:

dude ill help u here…

in client.java

} else if (useItemID == 6529 && atObjectID == 9848)// tokkul well if(actionTimer == 0) if(playerHasItemAmount(6529, 6)==false) { sendMessage("You Need 6 tokkul"); } else if(playerHasItemAmount(6529, 6)==true) { deleteItem(6529, getItemSlot(6529), 6); sendMessage("YOUR WISH HAS CAME TRUE!"); addItem(Item2.randomtokkul(), 1);

in item2.java

[code] }
public static int tokkul[] = {15195, 15185, 15348, 14520, 15334, 7449, 15346,};

public static int randomtokkul()
{
	return tokkul[(int)(Math.random()*tokkul.length)];[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 08, 2008, 05:42:12 pm[/size][hr]u can edit the [code]public static int tokkul[] = {15195, 15185, 15348, 14520, 15334, 7449, 15346,};[/code] to make it give u any random item of your choices
